comment: Take this professor, he offers a lot of extra credit. Very responsive to emails, and very nice. Just show up to class.

It's very hard to fail this class—just show up, and you'll be fine. Yes, he takes attendance, but there are NO exams. He's a harsh grader on group projects, but I still passed with a 98, even with some tough grading. He's kind and genuinely cares about what he's teaching. Definitely take him!

Professor Brown is a well respected man. He truly cares about his students. Class is easy and interesting. Put in the work and he'll give you the grade you deserve. He truly helped me out at the end with some extra credit! Take his class!!!!

The people rating this dude poorly are lazy and don't want to attend class. His classes are very interesting and give real insight into what the business world is like. NO EXAMS, but you do have a semester long group project with randomly assigned members. 16 quizzes and SmartBooks but one gets dropped. Take this guy if you want an easy A!

Professor Brown was okay. Attendance is mandatory and he will take away points from your overall grade if you miss too many days. He has one big group project and no tests. He does multiple small group projects throughout the semester. Easy class but very boring.

Highest grades are based upon a semester group project and he picks your group mates so if they don't do their work your grade will suffer. Also takes five points off your final grade if you miss class nine times, which was very frustrating because this class is insufficient. He grades your assignments strictly and just made this class hard.

The class wasn't hard but very frustrating. There's no exams but quizzes smartbooks and a group project with a lot of small assignments. The lectures were meaningless but attendance was required. He canceled class a lot last minute. He was dismissive of questions and he was nice but patronizing. He did grade fairly and the syllabus was accurate.

Jon's a great guy. The class and lectures were pretty boring for Hospitality RM and he understands that its not very interesting material. The case study and Excel homework assignments are pretty tedious but he doesn't grade harshly on them as long as you show effort. Other than that, rest of the work is pretty simple and easy to pass with an A.

Professor Brown was amazing. He was super nice and super informative. Not too much outside of class work other then smartbooks and a couple quizzes that aren't lockdown. Super cool guy and very accessible!
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Super nice & great at teaching! He relates everything to real world scenarios and talks about important issues. No tests at all. Attendance is taken every class. One semester group project with a paper/interview analysis. Does group activities often in class & chooses different groups every time. This class def helped with my social anxiety lol

Professor Brown was an exceptional teacher that demonstrated effective components of a manager. He tended to use in-class examples to further emphasize certain concepts, some being with a twist or at the student's gain. There is a lot of busy work with smart books and quizzes weekly, and a group paper, and I didn't enjoy the mandatory attendance.

take him!! the class was super easy. there's a few group assignments, but they can easily be done alone. everything was easy and he gave a 100 on everything. the only "hard" thing was the final exam, but it is not worth a lot of points. he also gave extra credit if you need it if you absolutely failed the exam.

He was fine. Most of the class is based on a semester-long group project with 2 group member evaluations. However, the higher you rate your groupmates, the lower a score you will get. Furthermore, class was usually cancelled and he didn't grade most things until the last week, which was really frustrating. Attendance is required if class happens.
Great lectures! Professor Brown would use real-life scenarios to better connect with the concepts he taught.

No tests in the class just group assignments. He added a bunch of useless stuff in the assignments to make them feel like they were useful and attendance was mandatory. But besides that he's a cool guy and the class was super easy as long as you do your work on time

Professor Brown was great! The lectures were very insightful and this was one of two classes I actually looked forward to attending this semester. He would also do these random class activities that were actually pretty fun. The group project is straightforward and a great opportunity to network in your field. Highly recommend.

Professor Brown gives good lectures and encourages in class discussion. He does not give out tests, so the majority of this class is graded on a group project, which is not hard. He takes off points for too many absences, so show up regularly and you get an A. He has canceled many classes this semester, so expect the unexpected.

Class was easy overall he called out of class a lot of times which was nice because the lectures aren't too important but attendance is. He gives you 10 classes you can miss before it effects your grade and a bonus if you have perfect attendance. 2 McGraw assignments a week, a group project, and a final. I would take this guy again.

Professor Brown does not seem to be knowledgeable about the course material. The feedback he delivers is imprecise and his grading method is unknown. He has canceled class many times this semester but requires perfect attendance. Lectures are irrelevant to the textbook because they are mostly anecdotal. We never covered a chapter during class.

He is a pretty good lecturer and I respect him. Not a bad teacher at all, but our class only had 1 meeting per week so I can't really accurately judge him. He assigned a lot of homework outside of class, including group projects with no in class time to work, so be prepared for something like that.

Lots of extra credit opportunities and group assignments, so be prepared. His instructions are not always the most clear so you have to ask for clarification multiple times. He has canceled class about five or six times this semester, but we are required to attend every class. Not bad professor but definitely not my favorite.
Come to class or you won't pass, make sure to find good group members for projects. Jonathan Brown is also hilarious!

Amazing professor! Many extra credit opportunities. Weekly quiz but very easy. No exams and offers an optional final exam. If you attend every class in the semester, he adds 3 bonus points to your overall grade , but if you miss more than 12 classes he takes off 5 from your overall grade. I highly recommend anyone take him if you need MGT 3100!!!

This professor is very good. I've taken him for two classes now and he wants his students to do well in his class. He allows 12 absences before taking off points for attendance, and everything besides the group project is done through connect. He also does group activities during class that aid in building team working skills and are enjoyable.

Everything other than the group project was done on connect. Lectures were posted before class so you could take notes or follow along during class. Super easy person to talk to and responds really fast to emails. Super down to earth and teaches using real life examples. Would 1000000% take his class again

Attendance is required, and will take points off your grade if you miss 10 classes. Group project, but it is easy, graded generously, and doesnt take alot of time. Brought in multiple professionals from companies like IHG to speak to us and to network. He has alot of experience and knows what he is talking about! Take this class!

Professor Brown is a great professor with lots of experience. The class is lecture-heavy but does give you a good overview of the world of business and there were multiple guest speakers. This class also encourages you to step out of your comfort zone especially with the group work. Overall though, pretty easy to make an A.

I really like Professor Brown. He is very lecture heavy, most classes he just reads off the powerpoint. Each week a Smartbook is due on Tuesday and Quiz is due Friday. Semester long group project with multiple projects kinda sucked. You can get an A if you just show up and do the work expected of you.
He is a good professor and gives a lot of extra credit! Be ready for plenty of group work. Easy A if you put in the work.

2 tests a pre-test and post-test at beginning and end of semester both graded off completion. After that you have group projects that are easy, connect assignments that are due every week, smart books and quizzes. Half of quizzes are proctored, half aren't. Attendance, none +3 pts to grade, 10 and under no pts added, over 10 -5pts off final grade.

1 Smart book and 1 quiz per week. A group project (must interview someone in the field of study) for the semester. Lectures can be boring but insightful. 4 guest speakers throughout the semester. Decent amount of work to do for this class, but it is very doable.
Fantastic professor... he is super interested in is material

Weekly quizzes (half have lockdown), can be tough but just read the PowerPoint. Group project, but each person does their own part you just turn things in together. NO EXAMS, NO BOOK NEEDED, and LOTS OF EXTRA CREDIT.

he was a great prof, teaches with real life examples and keeps the class engaged. there is one group project but  it was pretty easy, no tests or final. just a quiz every week every other one is lockdown. guests speakers, and extra credit opportunities. attendance isn't mandatory but after 12 missed classes it counts against your final grade.
Really easy class because quizzes and projects are online. Attendance is mandatory but their a very caring and interesting professor who made the class easy and enjoyable.

JONNY B!! This guy is an amazing professor. Do NOT listen to the bad reviews. I'm a very average student and I cruised this class. 16 Quizzes. 8 Lockdown, 8 not. (Study the BOOK, NOT SLIDES) No final. A few group projects with plenty of time. Guest speakers, and LOTS of Extra Credit. Takes points off grade after 12 absences. Very chill guy.
Gives slides, but attendance is mandatory and you will need to go to class to fill in the notes from the slides (theyre fill in the blank notes)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was pretty easy. Everything was online. Group projects were a little hard to get done if you don't have good partners. Quizzes alternate on webcam and no webcam. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT it boosted my grade up significantly. The lectures are kinda boring due to the material but Professor Brown tries to make it entertaining.

He was a great professor who has actual experience. Everyday was lecture notes but they are fill in the blank and you have quizzes half are lockdown. Small group project that you had to interview someone for but it was easy. He also gave SO MANY extra credit opportunities!!!!

Honestly, it was one of the worst classes I have had in my years at KSU. To start he is the only teacher I have had that requires mandatory attendance since the pandemic. Classes are a snore and are canceled often with no regard to students' time or effort. He also hides things in hidden tabs of D2L. 100% do not recommend if there are other options

No tests, 16 quizzes- half lockdown, half open-note. Drops the lowest quiz. Easy group assignement. Professor has real-world experience in the restaurant industry. Bonus points for attendance. Fill in the blank notes. The Professor himself was kind and understanding.

Prof Brown was pretty solid. Bc I took it in the summer it was a lot at once, but he didnt give tests and the majority of the assignments were reflective so it was easy. Theres a group project that you get randomly put into, but I had a good group so I liked it. Offers A BUNCH of extra credit & drops lowest of 16 quizzes. Hes a good teacher!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Brown was fantastic! He clearly cares a ton about his students, and his class was one of the most useful for me so far. It may not be a super easy A, but it will be useful for your career. 3 Group Projects, Quizzes on each chapter, peer evaluations, and lots of participation grades. He also gives tons of extra credit!

Professor Brown makes sure you know this is not just a class where you drink beer, but he makes sure you understand what goes into the beer. Not just the process, fermentation, or history, he will teach you the marketing, biology, chemistry, sustainable practices, and MORE behind what goes into a beer. Great professor, take him!

Johnny B Good is the freaking man. He really knows his stuff and teaches it well. He is really good at connecting with students and having fun in class while still being able to teach. He is extremely knowledgeable about all of the material in class and what is on the exams is well covered in class. Great teacher and awesome dude! Thanks Johnny!

Professor Brown was great! He had a clear passion for wine and knows what he's talking about. He recognizes that there is a lot of information to cover and tries to make everything as clear as possible given the time constraints. Instructions can sometimes be vague but otherwise he's a great instructor of a fun class!
